com.epoch.chem
Class Dihedral

java.lang.Object
  com.epoch.chem.Dihedral

public class Dihedral
extends Object

Methods for doing 3D geometry such as calculating dihedral angles or bond angles. The implementation is based on a fairly simple 3D vector representation that provides methods required by dihedral calculation but nothing more.
This class has a main() method that takes 5 parameters, a molecule string (e.g. smiles) and four atom indices (starting from 0). If the input molecule has no 3d data (e.g. a SMILES is given) the 3D coordinates are calculated. Hydrogens are always added. 

 Usage example: java Dihedral "C1CCCCC1" 1 2 3 4
The above example calculates the dihedral angle over the bond between atoms 2 and 3 with respect to atoms 1 and 4.

setMolecule

public void setMolecule(Molecule m)
Initializes the dihedral calculator object by the given Molecule.

Parameters:
m - a molecule whose dihedral angles can be calculated by subsequent calls of calcDihedral

calcDihedral

public double calcDihedral(MolAtom atom1,
                           MolAtom atom2,
                           MolAtom atom3,
                           MolAtom atom4,
                           String degOrRadian,
                           int range)
Calculates and returns the dihedral angle specified by the given atoms. The angle is measured around the bond atom2-atom3 with respect to atom1 and atom4. Typically, atom1 is a neighbor of atom2, while atom4 is a neighbor of atom3.
The angle calculated is the angle between planes atom1 atom2 atom3 and atom2 atom3 atom4.

Parameters:
atom1 - neighbor of atom2
atom2 - first atom of the bond for which dihedral is calculated
atom3 - second atom of the bond for which dihedral is calculated
atom4 - neighbor of atom3
degOrRadian - whether to return the value in degrees or radians
range - whether to return a value between 0 and 180 or 0 and 360
Returns:
the dihedral angle

calcDihedral

public double calcDihedral(int i1,
                           int i2,
                           int i3,
                           int i4,
                           String degOrRadian,
                           int range)
Calculates and returns the dihedral angle specified by the given atoms. Atom indices refer to the Molecule object set by the last call of setMolecule(). The angle is measured around the bond atom2-atom3 with respect to atom1 and atom4. Typically, atom1 is a neighbor of atom2, while atom4 is a neighbor of atom3.
The angle calculated is the angle between planes atom1 atom2 atom3 and atom2 atom3 atom4.

Parameters:
i1 - index of neighbor of atom2
i2 - index of first atom of the bond for which dihedral is calculated
i3 - index of second atom of the bond for which dihedral is calculated
i4 - index of neighbor of atom3
degOrRadian - whether to return the value in degrees or radians
range - whether to return a value between 0 and 180 or 0 and 360
Returns:
the dihedral angle

calcDihedral

public double calcDihedral(MolAtom atom1,
                           MolAtom atom2,
                           MolAtom atom3,
                           MolAtom atom4,
                           String degOrRadian)
Calculates and returns the dihedral angle specified by the given atoms. Atom indices refer to the Molecule object set by the last call of setMolecule(). The angle is measured around the bond atom2-atom3 with respect to atom1 and atom4. Typically, atom1 is a neighbor of atom2, while atom4 is a neighbor of atom3.
The angle calculated is the angle between planes atom1 atom2 atom3 and atom2 atom3 atom4.

Parameters:
atom1 - neighbor of atom2
atom2 - first atom of the bond for which dihedral is calculated
atom3 - second atom of the bond for which dihedral is calculated
atom4 - neighbor of atom3
degOrRadian - whether to return the value in degrees or radians
Returns:
the dihedral angle in range of 0 to 180 or π

proj1onPlaneNormalTo2

public static DPoint3 proj1onPlaneNormalTo2(DPoint3 vector1,
                                            DPoint3 vector2)
Generates a projection of vector1 on a plane perpendicular to vector2. Both vectors originate at a center. Formula from http://www.euclideanspace.com/maths/geometry/elements/plane/lineOnPlane/index.htm

Parameters:
vector1 - vector to be projected
vector2 - plane-defining vector
Returns:
the projection

pointInRect

public static boolean pointInRect(DPoint3 p,
                                  MRectangle box)
Determines if a point is in a box. Algorithm: true if angles between vectors to adjacent corners add up to 360 degrees.

Parameters:
p - a point
box - a rectangle defined by four points
Returns:
true if the point is in the box defined by the four points

pointInRect

public static boolean pointInRect(DPoint3 p,
                                  MRectangle box,
                                  double scale)
Determines if a point is in a box. Algorithm: true if angles between vectors to adjacent corners add up to 360 degrees.

Parameters:
p - a point
box - a rectangle defined by four points
scale - how much to change the size of the rectangle
Returns:
true if the point is in the box defined by the four points

pointOnLine

public static boolean pointOnLine(DPoint3 p,
                                  MPolyline line)
Determines if a point is on a line. Algorithm: true if angles between vectors to line endpoints add up to 180 degrees.

Parameters:
p - a point
line - a line
Returns:
true if the point is on the line

main

public static void main(String[] args)
Allows to test the Dihedral class. Takes five parameters, a molecule string and 4 atom indices and output the dihedral angle spcified by these four atoms.
